intro: Tordylium hasselquistiae, commonly known as the Cape Verde star-flower, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Tordylium hasselquistiae is often found growing on rocky slopes and is a rare example of flora unique to the Cape Verde archipelago.
